column2: Fuller tore his ACL and is expected to miss the entire season.
Anderson has been placed on the PUP list due to a foot injury.

Powell has been suspended four games for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs and is recovering from a torn meniscus. He will likely be recovered from the knee injury by the end of September but will only be eligible to play Octobe
Elder has a patella stress fracture and his availability against the 49ers in the season opener is unknown.
Johnson has landed on the injured reserve list as he underwent surgery to repair a right knee injury.
Trevathan is recovering from a torn patellar tendon and his availability against the Falcons in Week 1 is in question.
McPhee has been placed on the PUP list with a right knee injury.
Bernard is recovering from a torn ACL that ended his 2016 season and his status for the season opener against the Ravens is up in the air.
Jones has been issued a one-game suspension for violating the league's personal conduct policy. He will be eligible to play against the Texans on September 14.
Wilson has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list after aggravating a previous knee injury.
Ross is recuperating from a previous shoulder injury and there is no timetable for return.
Peerman has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a pulled hamstring.
Iloka sprained his knee but is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Ravens on September 10th.
Greco is recovering from a foot injury and there is no timetable for a return.
Jackson has been placed on injured reserve due to a knee injury.
Bitonio is recuperating from a Lisfranc injury that ended his 2016 season and it is unknown as to if he will be ready for the season opener against the Steelers.
Wilson is on the PUP list due to a fractured kneecap.
Barker has been placed on the injured reserve list with a ruptured left Achilles.
Michael has been designated for the injured reserve list with an injury to an unannounced location.
Geathers is on the PUP list as he is recovering from offseason surgery to repair a neck injury and will miss the first six games of the season.
Langford has landed on the PUP list due to offseason surgery to fix a knee injury but is expected to be activated before the start of the season.
Schwenke has been designated for the PUP list with an unspecified injury but is likely to make his season debut against the Rams during Week 1.
Luck has been placed on the PUP list while he recuperates from surgery to repair a torn labrum in his shoulder but is expected to play in the season opener against the Rams.
Bucannon has been placed on the PUP list while recovering from surgery to repair a lingering ankle injury.
Zamort has landed on injured reserve due to a torn ACL.
Fua is on injured reserve due to a knee injury.
Irving has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs and will not be eligible to play until Week 5 against the Packers.
Thomas has been placed on injured reserve with a hamstring injury.
Smith is recuperating from a knee injury and a nerve issue that forced him to sit out the entire 2016 season but is expected to make his debut September 10 against the Giants.
Dysert is set to undergo season-ending surgery to repair a herniated disc in his back.
Collins sustained a hip flexor injury and there is no timetable for return.
Durant has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list as he needs to get in shape before he can be activated.
Ash has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a back injury.
Elliott is facing a possible suspension for his role in an off-field incident, leaving his status for the season opener against the Giants up in the air.
Gregory is serving a year-long suspension for violations of the league's substance abuse policy.
Ray suffered a torn ligament in his left wrist and is expected to miss six-to-eight weeks.
Booker has been designated for the PUP list with a fracture in his wrist but is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Chargers.
Barrett has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a hip injury but is expected to return sometime in September.
Butt has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list as he is recovering from offseason surgery to repair a right ACL tear.
Peko has been designated for the PUP list while he recuperates from a surgery to repair a broken right foot.
Kelly is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list while he recovers from a wrist injury.
Paradis is recovering from two-offseason surgeries to repair his left and right hips but is expected to be available Week 1 against the Chargers.
Chubb is on injured reserve due to an injury to an unannounced location.
Thornton has been issued a six-game suspension by the NFL for violating the league's substance-abuse policy but is expected to be available October 29th against the Steelers.
Ansah has been placed on the PUP list with an unspecified injury.
Thomas has been placed on the PUP list with an unspecified injury.
Martin has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an ankle injury.
Decker has landed on the PUP list as he underwent surgery to repair a torn labrum in his shoulder and is expected to miss four-to-six months.

Bryant has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs and has been placed on the PUP list with an unknown ailment. He will be eligible to return against the Bears on October 22nd.
Robinson has landed on the PUP list with an undefined injury.
Kouandjio has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list while he recovers from hip surgery.
Guion has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance enhancing drugs but is expected to be available October 8th against the Cowboys.
Adams has a stress fracture in his foot and it is unclear if he will be ready for the season opener against the Seahawks.
Goodson is on the PUP list while he recuperates from ACL surgery and his status for Week 7 against the Saints is up in the air.
Allison has been suspended one game for violating the league's policy on personal conduct and will be eligible to play against the Falcons on September 17.
Biegel is on the PUP list while recuperating from surgery to repair a Jones fracture in his foot. He is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Seahawks.
Quessenberry has been battling lymphoma for the past three years and there is no timetable for a return.
Brown has been placed on the reserve/did not report list because he is holding out for a new contract. It is unclear at what point his contract situation will be resolved.
Heath has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unknown ailment.
Newton has been placed on the Injured-Reserve/PUP list while recovering from tears to both of his patellar tendons and will not play in the 2017 season.
Ramsey has been placed on the PUP list while he recovers from surgery on a core muscle.
Colvin has been placed on the PUP list with a foot injury.
Williams has been placed on the PUP list with an unspecified injury.
Nixon is on injured reserve due to an unknown ailment.
Johnson is recovering from a torn Achilles that ended his 2017 season and his status for opening day against the Patriots is unknown.
Hali has been placed on the PUP list with an unspecified injury.
Battle has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified injury.
Nicolas has landed on the PUP list with a knee injury.
Ehinger has been placed on the PUP list while he recovers from a previous ACL surgery.
Jones is on the PUP list while he recovers from offseason arthroscopic knee surgery.
McDonald has been handed an eight-game suspension for violating the league's substance abuse policy but is expected to make his season debut November 5th against the Raiders.
Pouncey is recuperating from an offseason stem cell procedure for his hip injury but is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Buccaneers.
Barrow has been placed on the injured reserve list with an unspecified injury.
Scott has been designated for the PUP list due to a foot injury.
Young is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list due to an unspecified injury.
Misi has landed on injured reserve with a neck injury.
Jones has been placed on the Active/Non-Football Injury list with a calf strain.
Bridgewater is on the PUP list while recovering from a dislocated knee and torn ACL.

Floyd has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list as he is recuperating from meniscus surgery that took place last season and team officials are concerned that it could be career-threatening as he is experiencing complications in his recove
Murray has been placed on the PUP list while he recovers from offseason ankle surgery.
Floyd has been suspended four games for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs. He will be eligible to join the team against the Bears in Week 5.
Fairley has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Illness list due to a heart condition.
Swann is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list until he passes his physical.
Phillips has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Illness list while he recovers from an appendicitis.
Ellerbe has been designated for the injured reserve list with a foot injury.
Armstead has been placed on the PUP list as he recovers from surgery to repair a torn labrum and will likely remain sidelined until Week 8 against the Bears.
Unger is on the PUP list to start training camp as he is recuperating from surgery to repair a foot injury but is expected to suit up for the start of the 2017 season.
Kelemete is dealing with an unspecified injury and is on the PUP list as a result.
Lawrence has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified ailment.
Hightower is on the PUP list with an undefined injury.
Branch has been designated for the PUP list as he has not passed his conditioning test.
Farris has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unknown ailment.
Williams has been placed on injured reserve with an unspecified injury.
Draughn has been placed on the PUP list with an unknown injury.
Thomas has been placed on the PUP list while recovering from an ACL injury.
Smith has been placed on the injured reserve list while he recovers from a torn ACL.
Marshall has been handed a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs but is likely to return against the Browns on October 8th.
Keeton has been placed on the injured reserve list with an unspecified injury.
Clark has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a knee injury.
Stewart is recovering from surgeries on his thumb and groin. His availability for the season opener against the Bills on September 10 is in question.
Seferian-Jenkins has been suspended two games by the NFL for violating the league's substance-abuse policy but is likely to make his season debut September 24 against the Dolphins.
Sharpe has been placed on the PUP list with a foot injury.
Dodd is battling a foot injury that plagued him for most of the 2016 season but is expected to suit up for the season opener against the Raiders.
Shittu has been placed on the injured reserve list due to a knee injury.
Williams has been designated for injured reserve with an Achilles injury.
Mathews is recuperating from offseason neck surgery and there is no timetable for return.
Allen has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list due to a torn pectoral muscle he suffered during the offseason.
Jones is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list while he recovers from a torn Achilles' tendon but is expected to be activated sometime in October.
Bell had offseason surgery to repair a groin injury and team officials will not announce an official timetable for a return until he is 100 percent healthy.
Severin has landed on the PUP list and will remain there until he passes his physical.
Coates has been placed on the PUP list while he recovers from an offseason knee scope but is expected to suit up for the season opener against the Browns.
Bryant missed the entire 2016-17 season due to a suspension and will remain out of action until his reinstatement has been finalized.
Ward has been placed on the PUP list while he recovers from left foot surgery.
Irvin has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified injury.
Helfet has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified injury.
Heeney has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list due to an ankle injury.
Smith remains suspended for an undetermined amount of time for violating the league's substance-abuse program.
Conley has been placed on the PUP list while recovering from shin splints.
Feliciano has been placed on the PUP list with a knee injury.
Edwards Jr. has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with strained hamstring.
Alexander has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified injury.
Joyner has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified injury.
Harkey has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unspecified injury.
Hill has been issued a two-game suspension for violating the league's substance abuse policy but is expected to return September 21 against the 49ers.
Thomas has been suspended four games for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs. He will be eligible to return against the Seahawks in Week 5.
Dunbar has been placed on the PUP list with a knee injury.
Easley will miss an unknown amount of time due to a serious knee injury.
Waller has been suspended for at least one year for violating the league's substance-abuse policy.
Flacco is bothered by stiffness in his back but will likely be ready for the season opener against the Bengals.
Dixon had season-ending surgery to repair his medial meniscus and has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs.
Young is on the PUP list with a torn ACL and will miss the entire 2017 season.
Gillmore is expected to miss the remainder of the season after having surgery to repair his MCL.
Siragusa suffered a torn ACL in his left knee and is expected to miss the remainder of the season.
Stuckey has been placed on the PUP list with an unspecified injury.
Verrett has been placed on the PUP list with an undisclosed injury.
Williams is suffering from a herniated disk in his back and is expected to miss an extended amount of time.
Locket is recovering from a broken leg and his status is unclear for the season opener against the Packers.
McEvoy had surgery to repair a toe injury and it is unknown as to if he will play against the Packers in the season opener.
Jordan had an operation to repair a knee injury and his status for opening day against the Packers is up in the air.
Shead underwent surgery to repair the torn ACL in his left knee during the offseason and there is no timetable for a recovery.
Avril is recuperating from offseason abdominal surgery and a timetable for a recovery has yet to be established.
Ward has landed on the PUP list with a hamstring injury and his status against the Panthers in Week 1 is unknown.
Smith is on the PUP list while recovering from ACL surgery and his status for the regular season opener against the Dolphins is unclear.
Martin will miss the first three weeks of the 2017 season as his suspension from the end of the 2016 campaign for violating the league's PED policy will carry over.
Murphy has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs but is expected to play October 15th against the 49ers.
Reed has been designated for the PUP list with a sprained big toe and soreness in his ankle.
Hall is on the PUP list while recuperating from surgery to repair a torn ACL in his knee.
Thompson has landed on the PUP list with an injured leg.
Marshall has been placed on injured reserve after having surgery to repair a torn right patellar tendon.
